member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.Contracts.PureAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that a type or method is pure, that is, it does not make any visible state changes.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.DisallowNullAttribute
member.summary: Specifies that null is disallowed as an input even if the corresponding type allows it.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.DoesNotReturnAttribute
member.summary: Applied to a method that will never return under any circumstance.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.DoesNotReturnIfAttribute

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified parameter value.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.ExperimentalAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that an API is experimental, and it may change in the future.

remarks.para: This attribute allows call sites to be flagged with a diagnostic that indicates that an experimental feature is used. Authors can use this attribute to ship preview features in their assemblies.

member.name: M:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.ExperimentalAttribute.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class, specifying the ID that the compiler will use when reporting a use of the API the attribute applies to.
member.param: The ID that the compiler will use when reporting a use of the API the attribute applies to.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.ExperimentalAttribute.DiagnosticId
member.summary: Gets the ID that the compiler will use when reporting a use of the API the attribute applies to.

remarks.para: The diagnostic ID is shown in build output for warnings and errors. This property represents the unique ID that can be used to suppress the warnings or errors, if needed.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.ExperimentalAttribute.UrlFormat
member.summary: Gets or sets the URL for corresponding documentation. The API accepts a format string instead of an actual URL, creating a generic URL that includes the diagnostic ID.
member.value: The format string that represents a URL to corresponding documentation.

remarks.para: An example format string is https://contoso.com/obsoletion-warnings/{0}.

member.param: The type of the builder to use to construct the collection.
The name of the method on the builder to use to construct the collection.

remarks.para: must refer to a static method that accepts a single parameter of type ReadOnlySpan<T> and returns an instance of the collection being built containing a copy of the data from that span. In future releases of .NET, additional patterns may be supported.

member.name: T:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.ModuleInitializerAttribute
member.summary: Used to indicate to the compiler that a method should be called in its containing module's initializer.

remarks.para:
When one or more valid methods with this attribute are found in a compilation, the compiler will emit a module initializer that calls each of the attributed methods.
Certain requirements are imposed on any method targeted with this attribute:

item.description: The method must be an ordinary member method, as opposed to a property accessor, constructor, local function, and so on.
The method must not be generic or be contained in a generic type.
The method's effective accessibility must be or .

remarks.para:
For more information, see the
ECMA specification .

member.name: T:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.CallerFilePathAttribute
member.summary: Allows you to obtain the full path of the source file that contains the caller. This is the file path at the time of compile.

remarks.para: You apply the attribute to an optional parameter that has a default value. You must specify an explicit default value for the optional parameter. You can't apply this attribute to parameters that aren't specified as optional.

member.name: T:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.CallerLineNumberAttribute
member.summary: Allows you to obtain the line number in the source file at which the method is called.

remarks.para: You apply the attribute to an optional parameter that has a default value. You must specify an explicit default value for the optional parameter. You can't apply this attribute to parameters that aren't specified as optional.

member.name: T:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.CallerMemberNameAttribute
member.summary: Allows you to obtain the method or property name of the caller to the method.

remarks.para: You apply the attribute to an optional parameter that has a default value. You must specify an explicit default value for the optional parameter. You can't apply this attribute to parameters that aren't specified as optional.

member.name: T:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.CallerArgumentExpressionAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that a parameter captures the expression passed for another parameter as a string.

remarks.para: This attribute is implemented in the compiler for C# 10 and later versions only.

member.param: The parameter to pass onto the constructor.
member.returns: The new instance of by passing the parameter to the constructor .

member.name: T:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.SkipLocalsInitAttribute
member.summary: Used to indicate to the compiler that the .locals init flag should not be set in method headers.

remarks.para: This attribute is unsafe because it may reveal uninitialized memory to the application in certain instances (e.g., reading from uninitialized stackalloc'd memory). If applied to a method directly, the attribute applies to that method and all nested functions (lambdas, local functions) below it. If applied to a type or module, it applies to all methods nested inside. This attribute is intentionally not permitted on assemblies. Use at the module level instead to apply to multiple type declarations.

member.name: T:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.RequiresPreviewFeaturesAttribute

member.name: T:System.Text.RegularExpressions.GeneratedRegexAttribute
member.summary: Instructs the System.Text.RegularExpressions source generator to generate an implementation of the specified regular expression.

remarks.para: The generator associated with this attribute only supports C#. It only supplies an implementation when applied to static, partial, parameterless, non-generic methods that are typed to return .

When the supports case-insensitive matches (either by passing or using the inline (?i) switch in the pattern) the regex engines will use an internal casing table to transform the passed in pattern into an equivalent case-sensitive one. For example, given the pattern abc, the engines will transform it to the equivalent pattern [Aa][Bb][Cc]. The equivalences found in this internal casing table can change over time, for example in the case new characters are added to a new version of Unicode. When using the source generator, this transformation happens at compile time, which means the casing table used to find the equivalences will depend on the target framework at compile time. This differs from the rest of the engines, which perform this transformation at run-time, meaning they will always use casing table for the current runtime.

member.name: M:System.Text.RegularExpressions.GeneratedRegexAttribute.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified pattern.
member.param: The regular expression pattern to match.

member.name: M:System.Text.RegularExpressions.GeneratedRegexAttribute.#ctor(System.String,System.Text.RegularExpressions.RegexOptions)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified pattern and options.
member.param: The regular expression pattern to match.
A bitwise combination of the enumeration values that modify the regular expression.

member.name: M:System.Text.RegularExpressions.GeneratedRegexAttribute.#ctor(System.String,System.Text.RegularExpressions.RegexOptions,System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified pattern and options.
member.param: The regular expression pattern to match.
A bitwise combination of the enumeration values that modify the regular expression.
The name of a culture to be used for case-sensitive comparisons. is not case-sensitive.

remarks.para:
For a list of predefined culture names on Windows systems, see the Language tag column in the list of language/region names supported by
Windows . Culture names follow the standard defined by BCP 47. In addition, starting with Windows 10, can be any valid BCP-47 language tag.
If is , the invariant culture will be used.

member.param: The regular expression pattern to match.

A time-out interval (milliseconds), or to indicate that the method should not time out.
The name of a culture to be used for case-sensitive comparisons. is not case-sensitive.

remarks.para:
For a list of predefined culture names on Windows systems, see the Language tag column in the list of language/region names supported by
Windows . Culture names follow the standard defined by BCP 47. In addition, starting with Windows 10, can be any valid BCP-47 language tag.
If is , the invariant culture will be used.

member.name: T:NullGuard.ValidationFlags
member.summary: Used by to target specific categories of members.

member.name: F:NullGuard.ValidationFlags.None
member.summary: Does nothing.

member.name: F:NullGuard.ValidationFlags.Properties
member.summary: Adds null guard checks to properties getter (cannot return null) and setter (cannot be set to null).

member.name: F:NullGuard.ValidationFlags.Arguments
member.summary: Method arguments are checked to make sure they are not null. This only applies to normal arguments, and the incoming value of a ref argument.

member.name: F:NullGuard.ValidationFlags.AllPublicArguments
member.summary: Processes all methods (arguments and return values) and properties.

member.name: F:NullGuard.ValidationFlags.OutValues
member.summary: Out and ref arguments of a method are checked for null just before the method returns.

member.name: F:NullGuard.ValidationFlags.ReturnValues
member.summary: Checks the return value of a method for null.

member.name: F:NullGuard.ValidationFlags.Methods
member.summary: Processes all arguments (normal, out and ref) and return values of methods.

member.name: F:NullGuard.ValidationFlags.AllPublic
member.summary: Checks everything (properties, all method args and return values).

member.name: F:NullGuard.ValidationFlags.NonPublic
member.summary: Applies the other flags to all non-public members as well.

member.name: F:NullGuard.ValidationFlags.All
member.summary: Wildcard.

member.name: T:NullGuard.AllowNullAttribute
member.summary: Prevents the injection of null checking (implicit mode only).

member.name: T:NullGuard.NullGuardAttribute
member.summary: Prevents the injection of null checking (implicit mode only).
member.param: The to use for the target this attribute is being applied to.

member.name: M:NullGuard.NullGuardAttribute.#ctor(NullGuard.ValidationFlags)
member.summary: Prevents the injection of null checking (implicit mode only).
member.param: The to use for the target this attribute is being applied to.

member.name: T:wawa.Modules.ISolvable
member.summary: Interface for Twitch Plays auto-solvers. Used by to abstractly communicate with Twitch Plays solvers without importing the namespace.

member.name: P:wawa.Modules.ISolvable.IsTP
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether Twitch Plays is currently active.

remarks.para: This is for modules that need to display different items, or use different rules if Twitch Plays is active.

These values are set by the Twitch Plays mod using reflection. This field is set in Start(), therefore there's no guarantee that it'll be available there, the field must be first accessed in a delegate in or later.

member.name: M:wawa.Modules.ISolvable.ForceTPSolve
member.summary: When the module runs into an exception or the module is forced to be solved, it calls this method.

remarks.para: Make sure that the module is solved before this method closes, otherwise it causes a forced-solve.

member.returns: A series of instructions for the Twitch Plays mod to handle in order to guarantee a solve.
